Verse: Still don't know what I was waiting for
And my time was running wild, a million dead-end streets and
Every time I thought I'd got it made
It seemed the taste was not so sweet
So I turned myself to face me
But I've never caught a glimpse
Of how the others must see the faker
I'm much too fast to take that test
I watch the ripples change their size
But never leave the stream of warm impermanence and
So the days float through my eyes
But still the days seem the same
And these children that you spit on
As they try to change their worlds
They're quite aware of what they're going through
Chorus: Ch-ch-changes, don't want to be a richer man
Ch-ch-changes, just gonna have to be a different man
Ch-ch-changes, don't tell them to grow up and out of it
You've left us up to our necks in it
Ch-ch-changes, oh, look out you rock 'n' rollers
Ch-ch-changes, pretty soon now you're gonna get older
I said that time may change me
Bridge: Ah, changes are taking the pace I'm going through
